description: Unique identifier linking this record to an Equipment/History (EH) entity, such as the vehicle or asset associated with the fueling; likely a foreign key; confirm with SME.
Calendar date the fueling transaction occurred, typically in YYYYMMDD.
Time of day the fueling occurred; stored in a compact numeric format (e.g., minutes after midnight or HHMM). Exact format may vary; confirm with SME.
System-generated unique identifier for this record in the source fueling system, used to uniquely reference the transaction row.
Billing code used to route the charge to the appropriate customer, cost center, or invoice group.
Operating company code responsible for the transaction, used for organizational and financial reporting.
Date the transaction was posted to accounting or the back-office system, typically in YYYYMMDD.
Department or cost center charged for the product or service.
Identifier or name of the employee associated with the transaction (for example, the driver). May be blank when unknown.
Code indicating the party type involved (for example, employee versus other). Code list may vary; confirm with SME.
Markup rate or amount applied to the base unit cost to derive the charge-out price for this transaction.
Indicator that pricing, limits, or authorization were overridden for this transaction. Code meanings vary; confirm with SME.
Quantity dispensed, in the productâ€™s unit of measure (such as gallons or liters).
Identifier of the site and the pump/nozzle where the product was dispensed.
Identifier linking to the transaction header (TH) record. Values like zero may indicate no header link; confirm with SME.
Business key for the transaction header in the source system; often blank when not provided.
Tax classification applied to the transaction, used to determine applicable tax calculation rules.
Total tax amount charged for the transaction.
Time the transaction was posted to accounting or back-office systems. Stored in a vendor-specific numeric format; confirm format and timezone.
Total monetary amount charged for the transaction, including taxes and adjustments.
External transaction number assigned by the fueling system or batch, used for reconciliation and auditing.
Product or fuel type code. Numeric values may map to named types; confirm the code set with SME.
Unit price of the product at the time of sale (per gallon or liter), before taxes.
Transaction type code indicating the nature of the entry (e.g., dispense, invoice, adjustment). Code definitions vary; confirm with SME.
